projects.title: Project on how to detect Credit Card Fraud at Ivy Professional School
projects.description: Responsibilities : 1â€”Built a classifier that can detect credit card fraudulent transactions. 2-- We used a variety of ML algorithms using R to implement this model and also plotted the respective performance curves for the models. We learnt how data can be analyzed and visualized to discern fraudulent transactions from other types of data.

projects.title: Project to predict the Customer Churn for a large Telecom service provider from India using Logistic Regression on R at Ivy Professional School.
projects.description: Responsibilities:1â€”Designed a Classification model using Logistic Regression in R to classify Churners with an accuracy of 75%, nagelkerke RSquare of 53%, K-S statistics of 56%. The Dataset consists of 110 features with one lakh thirty thousand customers.2â€”Also used Decision Tree and Random Forest for customer churn analysis for this particular dataset equally fine.

projects.title: For an Auto Insurance company, we need to predict the conditions affecting customer lifetime value(CLV) so as to make sure how much benefit each customer can repay to the company in exchange of the benefits he or she receives
projects.description: Responsibilities :1â€”Designed a regression model in R to find out how and why the clv gets affected and how to tackle clv so that the company can benefit.2--Taking clv as the dependent variable and the whole model based on this variable, developed the model with adjusted R-square of 93.47% and MAPE of 0.123â€”To validate the model, parameters like ANOVA, P-Value,R square was checked.4â€”To check the Linear Regression Assumptions,various Hypothesis Tests are done.
